definitions.text: a piece of open land for recreational use in an urban area
examples: they went for a walk in the park

definitions.text: belonging to or participated in by a community as a whole; public
examples: common lands are set aside for use by all members of a community

definitions.text: having no special distinction or quality; widely known or commonly encountered; average or ordinary or usual
examples: it is common knowledge that she lives alone

definitions.text: common to or shared by two or more parties
examples: the mutual interests of management and labor

definitions.text: being or characteristic of or appropriate to everyday language
examples: the vulgar tongue of the masses
the technical and vulgar names for an animal species

definitions.text: of or associated with the great masses of people
examples: the common people in those days suffered greatly
behavior that branded him as common

definitions.text: of low or inferior quality or value; - Shakespeare
examples: of what coarse metal ye are molded
produced...the common cloths used by the poorer population

definitions.text: lacking refinement or cultivation or taste
examples: he had coarse manners but a first-rate mind
behavior that branded him as common
an untutored and uncouth human being
an uncouth soldier--a real tough guy
appealing to the vulgar taste for violence
the vulgar display of the newly rich
